df7a4aa8-422c-4ca0-b507-33393664b6f8.description: A group of role models, advocates and team players that focuses on culture and aims to represent the voice of our workforce. They keep a pulse on the culture within functional groups and geographies, provide guidance to Executive Leadership on culture-related matters and share stories that embody our culture and values. Also, they propose and develop programs that support Kinaxis culture, values and initiatives. They enable peer-to-peer connections and are a feedback channel for the workforce.
df7a4aa8-422c-4ca0-b507-33393664b6f8.name: Kinaxis Culture Ambassador

badge_template_activities.title: Culture Ambassadors are well-respected and are often recognized as role models when it comes to living our core values and the culture. They are strongly aligned with the company purpose and want to see the business succeed. Culture Ambassadors work well with others, and have – or can build – strong cross-functional relationships. They are excellent communicators and are valuable members of their teams. They go above and beyond, deliver high-quality work and are trusted and reliable.

ae1aae2f-abbe-4db2-8bfb-4944330071ea.description: Our core values reflect who we are when we’re at our best, and the choices we make each day that allow us to achieve our potential—today and in the future. The Spirit of Kinaxis Awards celebrate people for going above and beyond in their commitment to our values.
ae1aae2f-abbe-4db2-8bfb-4944330071ea.name: Spirit of Kinaxis

badge_template_activities.title: #BeReal-We are authentic, respectful and act with integrity. #LaughOften-We laugh, have fun and joke around; it’s how we build meaningful relationships. #BeSelfEmpowered-We are an empowered group of problem-solvers, thinkers and doers.  #StrongerTogether-We know the whole is greater than the sum of our parts.  #BeCustomerCentric-We feel great pride and a deep connection to our customers.  #BeAGlobalCitizen-We are connected as a global team, active in our communities to make the world better.

fb545c16-2a6f-413c-babd-0737b6629dc7.description: The Diversity, Equity and Inclusion Committee (DEI) is comprised of employees who personally care about DEI, have critical thinking skills and act as advocates. The Committee works closely with senior leaders and program owners to provide feedback and guidance to ensure alignment with the Kinaxis strategy and help design processes and programs that support and accelerate DEI goals. Members of the Committee have personal relevance, critical thinking and are company advocates.
fb545c16-2a6f-413c-babd-0737b6629dc7.name: Diversity, Equity and Inclusion Committee Member

badge_template_activities.title: Members of the Committee personally care about DEI. They read books, research best practices, reflect on the injustices that still exist in society, are aware of how bias and privilege impact our communities and are curious to learn from others. They are able to analyze complex subjects and draw reasonable conclusions based on diverse views, data points and objectives. They are strongly aligned with our vision, values and culture and want to see Kinaxis succeed, while caring about co-workers.

a5db986f-06d1-4054-a0d3-66a6ccded6f7.description: Earners of this certification demonstrate consistent application of all the core KCS fundamentals and mastery of the platforms Kinaxis leverages, and have gone above and beyond to improve the state of shared knowledge for both Kinaxis clients and the GCC organization as a whole. They have demonstrated their ability to search, summarize and write a knowledge article that is sufficient to solve a customer's problem.
a5db986f-06d1-4054-a0d3-66a6ccded6f7.name: Kinaxis Certified KCS Publisher

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the KCS @ Kinaxis training
Pass the Kinaxis Certified KCS Publisher exam
Must have a reuse metric between 60-80%
Write articles with a Content Standard Checklist score of over 80%
Minimum of ten KCS articles published in the past six months

Create a sample activity report showing knowledge contributions over a two-week period in the past six months. This report must show article creation and, if available, article modification, reuse and feedback.

64ac7b85-5acf-408a-8f87-a830b7ff84d6.description: The Kinaxis Certified RapidResponse Master is the pinnacle of achievement in the Kinaxis Certification Program. A Master is someone, board approved, who has highly advanced skills, lengthy experience and a depth of understanding not only of RapidResponse and multiple verticals but across supply chain as well. This person is a distinguished individual with multiple talents and is highly respected in the Kinaxis ecosystem.
64ac7b85-5acf-408a-8f87-a830b7ff84d6.name: Kinaxis Certified RapidResponse Master

badge_template_activities.title: Earn at least one Kinaxis Certified Level 2 Consultant and one Level 3 Kinaxis Certified Level 3 Consultant
Log 6000 hours (3 years) working on projects or engagements
Log 1000 hours in at least two different verticals
Deploy at least four different applications
Work in a mentoring, coaching and/or a leadership role covering a period of 2 years
Spend 3 months in a project leadership role
Have a minimum of 5 years of experience in the supply chain industry
Act as an influencer by blogging, presenting to executives, or making decisions that have a significant business impact.
Earn and have an active APICS, ISM, SCMA or PMI certification or an advanced degree in supply chain

Pass the Two-Date Planning Algorithm exam
Take 1 project through go-live
Develop lists to address gaps in workbooks, analytics and roles
Know the vertical-specific template
Understand core analytics (plant level MRP, CTP)
Mentor or supervise a Level 1 Core Solution Architect
Understand customer’s business issue to be solved
Translate requirements into our prescriptive solution
Develop a work list to pass to a Solution Consultant
